intro: Habracanthus harleyi, commonly known as the Harley's habracanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite and have a smooth, waxy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
